entries.meaning: Any of the types involved in polytypism.
examples: Orthochrysotile is a polytype of chrysotile.

entries.meaning: A cast, or facsimile copy, of an engraved block, matter in type, etc.
examples: Towards the end of the eighteenth century , Professor Wilson of Glasgow , being engaged in a series of experiments for making etchings upon glass with fluoric acid for the purposes of art , thought it possible to make polytypes of glass from engraved copperplates

entries.meaning: (computing theory) In the Hindley–Milner type system, a data type containing variables bound by one or more ∀ (for-all) quantifiers.

verbs.description: polytype (third-person singular simple present polytypes, present participle polytyping, simple past and past participle polytyped)
